summary: The bill, titled the Gambling Addiction Recovery, Investment, and Treatment Act (S. 454), aims to address gambling addiction. It authorizes the Assistant Secretary for Mental Health and Substance Use to award formula grants to states to combat gambling addiction, using funding based on a percentage of taxes received under the Internal Revenue Code. The National Institute on Drug Abuse can award grants for research. The bill mandates a report on the effectiveness of these programs within three years.
